spans.text: After months apart, the band’s rehearsal ended awkwardly like this.
Sitting on the train, Taki felt nothing but restless and frustrated.
She couldn’t shake the feeling that today’s practice ended unhappily, all because of her.
—Her body failing her, her inability to come up with a decent song, and her unreasonable behavior...
She knew full well her bandmates were just concerned about her, yet she still blurted out a lot of harsh words...
The train car was empty, and that was exactly what Taki wanted.
She didn’t want anyone to see her looking so troubled and dejected.

Outside the train window, the sunlight was glaring. Though it was past noon, the light piercing through the thin clouds was still bright and carried some heat. It was such an ill-fitting kind of weather.
The heat licked Taki’s arms, but it couldn’t provoke even the slightest reaction from her.
It was as if she were embedded into the train window, motionless.
Countless thoughts tangled like a web of vines around her heart, tightly wrapping her up.
(I understand. Everyone has their own responsibilities, and I know the band is no longer the top priority for anyone.)
(But why? Why does everyone act like they don't care?)
(It’s been so long since we last got together... Why did it end up like this...?)
The train arrived at the station, and the voice of the announcer seemed to urge her to leave quickly.
